Class Polygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • Shape
      • TwoDimensionalShape
        • Polygon
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Quadrilateral, Triangle

    public class Polygon
extends TwoDimensionalShape
    A polygon (/ˈpɒlɪɡɒn/) is a plane figure that is bounded by a finite chain of straight line segments closing in a loop to form a closed polygonal chain or circuit. These segments are called its edges or sides, and the points where two edges meet are the polygon's vertices (singular: vertex) or corners.
    Author:
    Teagen Kiel

      • getPerimeter

        public double getPerimeter()

      • computeAngle

        public static double computeAngle(StraightLine line1,
                                  StraightLine line2)
        This static method will compute the angle between two intersecting lines using the equation: tangent(theta) = |(m1-m2)/(1+m1m2)|. This method will return zero if the lines are parallel. The coordinates of each line must be set or computed prior to calling this method.
        Parameters:
        line1 - the first intersecting line
        line2 - the second intersecting line
        Returns:
        the computed angle in degrees
